name: Search_Flight_Location

docs_row.name: Search_Flight_Location
docs_row.func_description: Find airports by their location, address, state, country, etc.

query.description: Names of airport, locations, cities, districts, places, countries, counties etc.

languagecode.description:
To obtain the response data in a specific language, enter the languagecode. languagecode can be retrieved from api/v1/meta/getLanguages(Get Languages
) endpoint in Meta collection.

query.description: Names of airport, locations, cities, districts, places, countries, counties etc.

languagecode.description:
To obtain the response data in a specific language, enter the languagecode. languagecode can be retrieved from api/v1/meta/getLanguages(Get Languages
) endpoint in Meta collection.

response_summary:
The API response provides information about New York and its major airports. New York City, located in the United States, is represented with the code "NYC" and is part of the New York region. The city has two primary airports: John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK) and Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR).  

JFK Airport is situated approximately 21.38 kilometers from the city center, while Newark Airport is slightly closer at around 18.74 kilometers. Both airports serve the New York metropolitan area and are key transportation hubs in the US. The response also includes a shared photo link representing the city and its airports.
enhance_func_desc: This API is ideal for flight planning and destination searches. It retrieves location and airport details based on a query, including city codes, airport distances, and key transportation hubs. Users can search by city, airport, or region names and receive essential information like airport proximity and shared photo links. The response helps travelers identify convenient flight options and nearby airports.

enhanced_parameters.query: Search term for locations, airports, cities, or regions.
enhanced_parameters.languagecode: Language preference for the response data.

id.description: Unique identifier for the location, combining the code and type (e.g., 'NYC.CITY' for New York City, 'JFK.AIRPORT' for John F. Kennedy International Airport).

type.description: Type of the location, such as 'CITY' for cities or 'AIRPORT' for airports.

name.description: Full name of the location, e.g., 'New York' for the city or 'John F. Kennedy International Airport' for the airport.

code.description: Short code representing the location, such as 'NYC' for New York City or 'JFK' for John F. Kennedy International Airport.

regionName.description: Name of the region where the location is situated, e.g., 'New York'.

country.description: Country code where the location is located, e.g., 'US' for the United States.

countryName.description: Full name of the country, e.g., 'United States'.

countryNameShort.description: Short name or abbreviation of the country, e.g., 'US'.

photoUri.description: URL link to a photo representing the location.

distanceToCity.description: Distance from the airport to the city center.

unit.description: Unit of measurement for the distance, e.g., 'km' for kilometers.

parent.description: Identifier of the parent location, e.g., 'NYC' for airports located in New York City.

city.description: Code of the city where the airport is located, e.g., 'NYC' for New York City.

cityName.description: Name of the city where the airport is located, e.g., 'New York'.

region.description: Code of the region where the airport is located, e.g., 'NJ' for Newark Liberty International Airport.
